BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LYRIC OPERA OF KANSAS CITY INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE LYRIC OPERA OF KANSAS CITY PRODUCES PROFESSIONAL OPERA AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO MAKE LYRIC OPERA OF KANSAS CITY INDISPENSABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH TRANSFORMATIONAL OPERA EXPERIENCES AND BROAD SERVICE WHICH CAPTURES THE HEARTS AND MINDS OF OUR DIVERSE COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: OPERA PRODUCTIONS: LYRIC OPERA OF KANSAS CITY PRODUCED FOUR MAINSTAGE OPERAS IN THE 2022-23 SEASON, TOTALING 14 PERFORMANCES. WE OPENED THE SEASON WITH ONE OF THE MOST POPULAR OPERAS OF ALL TIME, BIZET'S "CARMEN," FOLLOWED BY VERDI'S "LA TRAVIATA." IN THE SPRING, WE PRESENTED COMPOSER PAUL MORAVEC AND LIBRETTIST MARK CAMPBELL'S CONTEMPORARY OPERA "THE SHINING," BASED ON THE CLASSIC HORROR NOVEL BY STEPHEN KING. THE LYRIC WAS ASKED TO PRODUCE THE WORK'S PREMIERE RECORDING IN COLLABORATION WITH THE KANSAS CITY SYMPHONY AND RENOWNED CONDUCTOR GERARD SCHWARZ. THE SEASON CONCLUDED WITH THE SEMI-STAGED CONCERT "SONDHEIM ON SONDHEIM," HONORING THE LEGACY OF THE LATE COMPOSER. WE ALSO OFFERED EIGHT PUBLIC PERFORMANCES OF THE HOLIDAY CLASSIC "AMAHL AND THE NIGHT VISITORS" IN OUR PRODUCTION ARTS BUILDING.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION/ENGAGEMENT: IN 2022-23, WE LAUNCHED OUR IN-SCHOOL EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVE OPERA UNLOCKED, WHICH INCLUDED AN IN-SCHOOL TOUR OF A NEWLY COMMISSIONED OPERA, "SKETCHBOOK FOR OLLIE;" SCHOOL PERFORMANCES OF "AMAHL AND THE NIGHT VISITORS;" NARRATIVE STORYTELLING WORKSHOPS; A RESIDENCY WITH YOUNG WOMEN ON THE MOVE; STUDENT DRESS REHEARSALS; LYRIC OPERA PRELUDES; AND SESSIONS ON CAREERS IN THE OPERA WORLD. COMMUNITY AND FAMILY PROGRAMMING ENCOURAGES PEOPLE OF ALL AGES TO BUILD LIFELONG RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE ARTS. 2022-23 PROGRAMMING INCLUDED COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS THAT EXPLORE THE "HERE AND NOW" IMPLICATIONS OF OPERA; OPERA DIVES DEEP PRESENTATIONS THAT PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO OUR SEASON; PRE-OPERA TALKS; OPERA TO GO PERFORMANCES AT RETIREMENT/ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES; AND DAYTIME PERFORMANCES OF OPERAS FOR FAMILIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF LYRIC FOUNDATION 587,998. CHANGE IN VALUE OF CRUT 93,460. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 84,921.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 TAX RETURN IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM. WHEN COMPLETE, IT IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THE BOARD FOR FINAL ACCEPTANCE PRIOR TO SUBMITTAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WHICH PERTAINS TO ITS BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH FISCAL YEAR, BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY AND ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS VIA AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORM. THE FORMS ARE REVIEWED BY THE TRUSTEE COMMITTEE, A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE FOR THE TRUSTEE COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. IF THE TRUSTEE COMMITTEE DETERMINES THAT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, IT IS BROUGHT TO THE BOARD FOR REVIEW AND CONSIDERATION. IF A CONFLICT DOES EXIST, THE BOARD WILL DETERMINE IF THE CONFLICT CAN BE MITIGATED OR IF THE CONFLICT PRECLUDES THE MEMBER FROM CONTINUING SERVICE TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. BOARD MEMBERS WITH CONFLICTS WHO ARE ALLOWED TO CONTINUE TO SERVE ON THE BOARD ARE REQUIRED TO RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM CONVERSATIONS AND VOTES PERTAINING TO THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD HAS AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, WHICH ACTS AS A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE AND COMPENSATION OF THE GENERAL DIRECTOR/CEO. THE COMMITTEE USES COMPARABILITY DATA FROM LOCAL AND NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS IN A SIMILAR FIELD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND 990 ARE POSTED IN THE ABOUT SECTION OF THE KCOPERA.ORG WEBSITE AFTER THEY HAVE BEEN ACCEPTED BY THE BOARD.
